DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group determined from information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for urinary bladder cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/9/17 tt transferred context; added Reg Status. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Bladder Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the staging of bladder carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: (T4b, N0, M0); (Any T, N1-3, M0); (Any T, Any N, M1).  T4b: Tumor invades pelvic wall, abdominal wall.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Single regional lymph node metastasis in the true pelvis (hypogastric, obturator, external iliac, or presacral lymph node).  N2: Multiple regional lymph node metastases in the true pelvis (hypogastric, obturator, external iliac, or presacral lymph node metastasis).  N3: Metastasis to the common iliac lymph nodes.  M0: No distant metastasis.  M1: Distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Bladder Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: (T4b, N0, M0); (Any T, N1-3, M0); (Any T, Any N, M1).  T4b: Tumor invades pelvic wall, abdominal wall.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Single regional lymph node metastasis in the true pelvis (hypogastric, obturator, external iliac, or presacral lymph node).  N2: Multiple regional lymph node metastases in the true pelvis (hypogastric, obturator, external iliac, or presacral lymph node metastasis).  N3: Metastasis to the common iliac lymph nodes.  M0: No distant metastasis.  M1: Distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage III includes: (T3a, N0, M0); (T3b, N0, M0); (T4a, N0, M0).  T3a: Tumor microscopically invades perivesical tissue.  T3b: Tumor macroscopically invades perivesical tissue (extravesical mass).  T4a: Tumor invades prostatic stroma, uterus, vagina.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Bladder Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage III includes: (T3a, N0, M0); (T3b, N0, M0); (T4a, N0, M0).  T3a: Tumor microscopically invades perivesical tissue.  T3b: Tumor macroscopically invades perivesical tissue (extravesical mass).  T4a: Tumor invades prostatic stroma, uterus, vagina.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: (T2a, N0, M0); (T2b, N0, M0).  T2a: Tumor invades superficial muscle (inner half).  T2b: Tumor invades deep muscle (outer half).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Bladder Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: (T2a, N0, M0); (T2b, N0, M0).  T2a: Tumor invades superficial muscle (inner half).  T2b: Tumor invades deep muscle (outer half).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0is includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ: "flat tumor".  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage 0is Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage 0is includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ: "flat tumor".  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0a includes: Ta, N0, M0. Ta: Papillary noninvasive carcinoma.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage 0a Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage 0a includes: Ta, N0, M0. Ta: Papillary noninvasive carcinoma.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: T1, N0, M0.  T1: Tumor invades subepithelial connective tissue. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Bladder Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: T1, N0, M0.  T1: Tumor invades subepithelial connective tissue. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that the extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

Concepts.definition: The extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Bladder Carcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage Stage Grouping Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
Concepts.definition: A term that refers to the staging of bladder cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
